text: No dislikes yet, as it should be.
author: Lightwatch

text:
Nice! One of my favourites off the album.
Um...first?
author: greenyxi

text: hate to be that guy, but does anyone have source for the image?
author: Sneaky Banana Man

text:
I'm surprised it took this long to put this track up. It's one of my favorites. When you posted the first song on YouTube, I knew I had to play this game just because of that one track. I built my own $800 PC, downloaded Steam, and bought Dustforce as my first game. It's your fault that I own over 200 games now. I just game on my PC and 3DS for the most part as of late. BTW, thanks for uploading this. :P

Peace. :)
author: nintendonick

text: a $150 machine would cut it for dustforce I think! :D
author: DavidBick

text: @DavidBick I wanted to get into PC gaming anyways. So that explains that. ;)
author: nintendonick

text: I thought this sounded familiar – it's the same artist who did the soundtrack for the Double Fine Adventure Kickstarter campaign documentary videos.
author: MishtahPoog

text: YES! One of my absolute favorite songs that has come from a game, ever. I've never played the game but the creator of its soundtrack really made something amazing.
author: ZaQen

text: I love this soundtrack so much, particularly this song.  I emailed Terence thanking him for his work on this game and he sent me a nice thank you back.  He seems like a really cool guy and I'm really looking forward to Spire.
author: chocolatekake

text: Great music!
author: Oz yaj

text: I was wondering if you were going to hit up this game.  Such good tunes!
author: psycosulu

text:
An average game to be honest, but this soundtrack is anything but. Easily makes it into my top 100, and I don't even like the game. It's just so beautiful, it sounds like a dream.

You have to feature Your Favorite Color sometime, that song is a masterpiece.
author: pseudogenesis

text:
I don't think it's fair to call it an average game (though sure it's your opinion).
Rather you just have to like the genre of the game 'Hyper precision platformer'.  When judged with similar games it is revolutionary and adds a level of depth, I've never seen before... but the genre is certainly not for everyone!
author: xSayPleasex

text: I considered saying "above average" but that kind of takes away from the point. It's a great game, and it does what it does well, but it's by no means a masterpiece.
author: pseudogenesis

text: I don't understand how the entire soundtrack isn't on your channel yet. The entire thing is absolutely gorgeous.
author: piggygobyebye

text: This song makes me feel like I'm flying through soundwaves.
author: Medal Melodies

text: Cider time? Sure, why not. I'm drinking some nice cold cider as I type this, love it almost as much as this game's soundtrack. I wonder if there's a video game theme called "Rum & Coke Time" I could upload tomorrow.

text: /watch?v=vKwH1JF8f6U - Is this close enough?
author: Prinselijkcoder

text:
@JulianMEdwards By the way, posting the entire link in a comment makes it appear as text with a link. For example, I pasted the URL of this video into the comment, and got:
Best VGM 1661 - Dustforce - Cider Time

text: @Mdude360 Did they change that? I always see people just putting in the /watch part.

text: @JulianMEdwards  It was included in the major november update last year, but I doubt everyone knows about all of the new update's functions yet.
